definitions.definition: To form or shape in an oblique way ; to cause to take an oblique position .

subdefinitions.definition: To cause (a distribution ) to be asymmetrical .

definitions.definition: To bias or distort in a particular direction .
examples: A disproportionate number of female subjects in the study group skewed the results.

definitions.definition: To move obliquely ; to move sideways , to sidle ; to lie obliquely.
To jump back or sideways in fear or surprise ; to shy , as a horse .
To look at obliquely; to squint ; hence, to look slightingly or suspiciously .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To form or shape in an oblique way ; to cause to take an oblique position .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To bias or distort in a particular direction .
( transitive , Northumbria , Yorkshire ) To hurl or throw .
( intransitive ) To move obliquely ; to move sideways , to sidle ; to lie obliquely.
( intransitive ) To jump back or sideways in fear or surprise ; to shy , as a horse .
( intransitive ) To look at obliquely; to squint ; hence, to look slightingly or suspiciously .
